release.action: Reasonable web config defaults for IPhone and PSP.
Debug logging for apple extensions.
Removed synchronized for "isRunning" method in WebServer to prevent deadlock when starting the server with no users and database update on server start enabled.
iPhone playlist type modified to really work in iPhone.
Option to use the mytunesrss.com address (default is TRUE) in playlists and for RSS feeds.

Use temporary file with only ascii characters for transcoder input. URL encode filenames on jukebox page. Use codewave-zis 1.1 to fix a JDK 1.6 problem if ZIP entry is not UTF-8 encoded. Do not create folder or file names with leading or trailing dots in ZIP archives.
Username and token were not URL encoded in last.fm GET request.
Fixed apple extensions problem introduced through extracting the extensions framework into its own project.
Checkbox state not correctly handled for "check for update on start" box.
Removed apple extensions from project and created a new standalone project for this. So mytunesrss can be built without any problems on non-apple systems now.
Username and password mandatory in JMX console when adding a user.
Version number not submitted for anonymous statistic when starting application.
Downgraded to commons-logging 1.0.4 to prevent strange problems when starting the server for the second time.
Commercial only, no free more anymore.
Overlay popups now work in Firefox, Safari, Opera and Internet Explorer.
Removed overlay popups on PSP and fixed login/password field visible lengths.
Fixed database pool leak.
commons-pool-1.4
Several JMX options added.
Do not add a watch folder for scanning if the same folder is already contained in the scanned folders set.
EAP license key valid until 2008-08-31 now.
Clickable links for "albums", "artists" and "genres" in database statistics on portal page.
User selectable start page for alphabet pager (0-9, A-C, all) in web settings.
Added options for "0/2", "0/3", "0/6" and "0/12" to the hour setting of a database schedule.
Fix for database migration to EAP-16 (this time really).
Fix for database migration to EAP-16.
Support for tomcat proxy host and tomcat proxy port (http and https connectors).
Do not send a submission for one track multiple times in a row to last.fm.

Import original artist into database (track table) so we have it even if some words are dropped from the name. This original name is used for last.fm scrobbling and for display purposes on the track info and in playlists and RSS feeds.
Disable anonymous statistics sender after 3 failures in a row.
Force all links to playTrack, downloadTrack, getZipArchive, showTrackImage and upload to be non-SSL.
Display message while removing tracks from database during update.

Added "-r" option to default lame command line to make it work on Windows as well.
Correct content type and no content length for RSS enclosures when file is being transcoded.
For more than 5 tracks in a section create a section playlist or use an existing one.
Added database index for track.image_hash to speed up removal of orphaned images a lot.

JSON-RPC sample application.

Use LogStreamCopyThread for transcoder error streams instead of writing to a file which was not thread safe.
